Company Name Tennis Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 137 views

Job description

Do you have a passion for our sport? We’re seeking a passionate and enthusiastic SharePoint Developer to join our Tennis HQ team.

Reporting to the\xa0Manager Business Applications, this role is to administer and configure the SharePoint environment (on premise and online), design and develop SharePoint templates, applications, and workflows, and provide training and support, as required. \xa0

As the SharePoint Developer, you will support our team in the following areas:


  • Administration of the Tennis Australia SharePoint environment(s) including developing SharePoint applications, workflows / solutions
  • Migration of SharePoint 2013 applications/workflows to SharePoint Online.
  • Collaborate with the Project Services team and adhere to the processes as part of development delivery: creation of use test cases, test scripts, etc.
  • Delivery Framework – Comply with improve system development templates (Change requests, BRDs, UAT, Release)
  • Provide project management support on agreed development items as assigned by IT Project Services Team.


What you’ll bring to the role:

  • Previous experience with Microsoft SharePoint technology stack
  • Previous experience using and configuring of 3rd party SharePoint plugins/solutions
  • Knowledge and experience of work-flow setup and configuration using Microsoft SharePoint Designer, Nintex work-flows and InfoPath forms
  • Knowledge and experience with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript and JQuery plugins as well as SQL databases
  • Knowledge and experience with SharePoint migrations from on premise to Online.


If you think you’re up to the challenge, we’d love to hear from you! For more information and a copy of the position description, visit our online job board.

\xa0
To Apply- Please submit your resume and cover letter via our online application system. Please note, only applications submitted through our system will be considered.
\xa0
APPLICATIONS CLOSE – WEDNESDAY 29th AUGUST @ 11pm (AEST)
\xa0
Tennis Australia is committed to providing a safe environment for all tennis participants, including children and young people. It is essential everyone involved with delivering tennis in Australia understands their responsibility in relation to child-safety.

At Tennis, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. Tennis encourages all suitable applicants to apply for this role

835031491:
[

Relationship Manager, Traditional Owners

Company Name Melbourne Water Company Location Docklands

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our Organisation

Melbourne Water makes a vital contribution to the lives of Melburnians through the supply of high quality water, reliable sewerage services, integrated drainage systems, flood prevention and by enhancing our waterways and land community use to achieve our vision of Enhancing Life and Liveability. Reporting to the Manager, Government and Policy, you will have the opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a positive work environment; one where people can learn and perform to their full potential.


\xa0


The Role

Melbourne Water is looking to appoint an engaging and passionate Aboriginal and/or or Torres Strait Islander person to lead the engagement with Traditional Owner Groups. This is a designated position for an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander individual.


As the Relationship Manager, Traditional Owners you will have the opportunity to contribute to change in the ways Melbourne Water engages Traditional Owners in decisions about our future services and management of resources and assets.


Melbourne Water greatly values the knowledge and capability that Traditional Owner Groups bring to the delivery of the services we provide to our customers and the broader community. To unlock this value there is a need for a truly cooperative and strategic approach to strengthen Traditional Owner participation in Melbourne Water.


For further information on the role and job responsibilities, please see the Position Description.


\xa0


Working at Melbourne Water

You will be part of a talented, passionate team dedicated to enhancing liveability in Melbourne and beyond. You’ll do truly meaningful work in a supportive and inclusive culture that encourages you to make the most of your individual talents.


We provide a range of employee benefits that will make your experience working at Melbourne Water both professionally and personally rewarding.


\xa0


Flexible Working

Melbourne Water is committed to flexible working, offering a variety of flexible arrangements to suit you and us, understanding that our customers business benefit from enabling employees to achieve balance in work and life.


\xa0


Diversity

Our inclusive workplace culture contributes to making Melbourne Water a great place to work.\xa0We are committed to creating a workforce which reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We welcome applications from everyone including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, people with a disability, mature age job seekers and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.


\xa0


Your Skills and Experience

The following skills and experience will contribute to success in the role:


  • Ability to create and foster relationships with Traditional Owners and the broader Victorian Aboriginal community
  • Advising on how Melbourne Water engages with Traditional Owner Groups
  • Contributing to and encouraging the development of strategies, policies and systems that work towards strengthening relationships with Traditional Owner Groups
  • Ability to navigate complex situations and consider the needs of all parties, and assist Melbourne Water to identify and work towards the most positive outcome
  • Advising and influencing Melbourne Water and its employees to develop the skills to effectively engage and communicate with Traditional Owner Groups and the broader Victorian Aboriginal community

Your ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders will also be beneficial for this role.


\xa0


How to apply

Click on the "apply" button and complete the online application form.


If you have any difficulties or questions regarding the application process, please contact Narelle Blencowe on (03) 9679 7308 or narelle.blencowe@melbournewater.com.au


If you would prefer to speak with an Aboriginal person, have any questions regarding the role or what it’s like to work at Melbourne Water, please contact Karen Milward, Aboriginal advisor on 0407 867 863.


\xa0


Closing date: Wednesday 12 September at 11:55pm AEST

Mid-Senior level

  • Utilities

Contract

  • Public Relations

Job description

Ultradata Australia is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our Design Team. This position is based in our Head Office located in Malvern East.


The purpose of this role is to provide highly skilled analysis, specification, design and workflow services that create innovative solutions for new and updated product functionality.


The role will suit a Business Analyst who has broad experience within retail banking and is familiar with current technology platforms.


Role & Responsibilities:


  • Undertake banking market trend analysis and recommend potential product enhancements;
  • Research and monitor the latest trends and technologies and provide suggestions on how they can impact the funtionality on our product offerings:
  • Develop reference documents that specify requirements and business rules, workflows, functional design, user interface designs and database design, depending on the nature of the assigned project;
  • Develop sound client relationships and revenue generating opportunities through the provision of specific fee-based consulting activities;
  • Analyse client and prospective client requirements, matching those with Ultradata products and services;
  • Assist Sales, Client Services and Marketing teams to define and deliver key messages on Ultradata products and services;
  • Deliver product and functionality overviews to the Ultradata team to ensure knowledge of new and updated products are shared;
  • Disseminate knowledge within Ultradata of existing and new products via a range of techniques suchas seminars, workshops, training sessions, printed collateral, knowledge base, frequently asked questions etc;
  • Participate in the provision of programs to improve the knowledge and talent collateral of clients and Ultradta employees on the functionality and application of existing and new solutions.


Skills, Competencies and Experience:


  • Relvant Tertiary Qualifications (Computer Science/Inforamtion Systems Business, Commerce, Economics) and/or extensive commercial experience;
  • Proven experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Prior experience working within banking and technology fields;
  • Legislative knowledge within the banking domain (highly desirable);
  • Familiarity with current technologies and devices;
  • Ability to provide creative commercial solutions using new and evolving technologies;
  • Ability to contirbute ideas and take ownership of assigned tasks;
  • Proven ability to manage priorities and time to meet assigned goals and deadlines;
  • Ability to build credible stakeholder relationships;
  • Ability to credibly translate information to different audiences;
  • Enthusiasm for creating financial services and banking solutions.


Please note, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 120 views

Job description

  • Fantastic opportunity to join a progressive and growing team
  • A team culture that prides itself on innovative civil engineering solutions
  • Grow your career with a Professional Development Partner of Engineers Australia
  • Watch your career (and skill set!) flourish as you undertake detail design on a range of exciting projects.


Dalton Consulting Engineers (DCE) is on an exciting growth path and recruiting and developing talented individuals to deliver what we're passionate about - innovative design and civil engineering solutions.


This is a career-building opportunity for a Civil Designer seeking career progression. Based in Richmond, our great location and new office fitout will provide you with the perfect environment to thrive as part of Team DCE.


Experience using 12d Model essential.



Tasks and Responsibilities

Reporting directly to the Senior Design Manager, you will:

  • Undertake intermediate design work (with instruction from Senior Design Managers)
  • Under instruction, take ownership of the design aspect of a project
  • Produce designs to DCE's 12d and CAD standards
  • Work on a variety of projects, predominantly subdivisions but also infrastructure and sporting projects


Skills and Experience

With 2-4+ years' experience you will have the following skills and qualifications:

  • 12d Model and AutoCAD software skills to an intermediate level
  • Bachelor of Engineering (Civil) or Diploma in Engineering
  • Experience in sub-divisional road and drainage design and WSAA Standards


Benefits and Perks

We are a people business. We work hard to provide an environment in which people can flourish and enjoy being part of the Team DCE culture. Working from our Richmond Office you will enjoy the following benefits:


Active Social Committee - internal lunches, sporting events, comedy evenings and movie nights (just to name a few).

Health & Wellbeing - fresh fruit, sporting teams, funruns and bike rides.


Leaning & Development Opportunities - professional development partner with Engineers Australia in addition to our Engineering Development Program and Peer Learning Network.


Light & Bright Office Space - new office fitout with plenty of greenery and end of trip facilities (showers, lockers, bike racks etc.). Disability access and facilities provided.


Great location - located riverside and within the Victoria Gardens precinct providing an abundance of amenity including cafes and restaurants, gymnasiums, parkland and Victoria Gardens Shopping Centre.


How to Apply

\xa0If this sounds like you and you want to enjoy the benefits and perks of being part of Team DCE, please send your cover letter and CV to careers@dceng.com.au\xa0with "<Your Name> - Civil Designer Richmond" in the subject header.

Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer.

Company Name Origin Energy Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 103 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 2 x Contract positions within our Digital team at Origin
  • Key member of Digital Delivery Team- Make an impact from day one
  • Application close date: 1st September 2018


Origin – Australia’s Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin offers exciting and rewarding career opportunities – from project management and leadership, to technical and engineering. Working for Origin can take you all over Australia – in the field, as well as in the office – or around the world. With global energy demand growing, Origin is looking for new ways to meet that need and create tomorrow’s energy solutions. It’s an exciting time to be a part of Origin.

Are you an agile thinker who wants to make a transformational impact? Are words like human-centred design, customer-first and personalised experiences music to your ears? If this sounds like you, then join us today in changing the way people think about energy and use it in their daily lives.

The Role

The Cloud Engineer is a key member of the Digital Delivery Team and is responsible for building and maintaining the Origin Retail digital platforms and applications as part of a cross functional squad.

You’ll be involved through the whole application delivery lifecycle and support the platform in production. You’ll need to be able to be a thought leader and work collaboratively with the other team members, communicate effectively with multiple technical and non-technical stakeholders and peers, have the insight and appetite to innovatively grow Origin’s customer base through awesome digital solutions.

You’ll Be Required To
  • Software analysis, design and development from an automation and operational perspective
  • Quality Assurance through test automation and test-driven development
  • CI/CD: continuous integration and continuous deployment through automation of builds and deployment scripts
  • DevOps: Operational support of the platforms in production
  • Thought leadership on the tools, processes, technologies through active involvement in Guilds
  • Mentoring and coaching of other team members
  • Being a key member of the cross-functional delivery team and working effectively with BA, Iteration Managers, Developers, QA, Architects, Security, UX, Product Owners etc

Is This You?
  • Demonstrated experience with operating systems such as Unix/Linux, system configuration, patching & maintenance security and networking
  • Demonstrated experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet
  • Experience with Docker or Kubernetes
  • Exposure and understanding of AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, CloudFront, CloudWatch, Route53, Availability Zones etc
  • Experience with applications deployed on AWS ecosystem and high order AWS services (RDS, SQS, SNS, DynamoDB etc)
  • Understanding of Elasticity and Scalability Concepts.
  • Demonstrated experience and understanding of the Agile software development methodology
  • Demonstrated experience and solid understanding of the TDD and BDD tools and techniques
  • Solid understanding of the CI/CD tools such as Jenkins and continuous delivery pipelines
  • Experience with Git version control tool
  • Demonstrated ability to take complex challenges and produce solutions that are simple and clear to user groups.
  • Great communications, presentation and attention to detail skills.
  • Creative, innovate thinker, with an ability to challenge and agitate the status-quo to inspire transformational change.


We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

MAKE AN IMPACT ON AUSTRALIA'S ENERGY FUTURE
If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.
Our story | Origin Energy

For more information, please contact Lisa Barry @ Lisa.Barry@originenergy.com.au

The Role


The dedicated Safer Communities team is excited about the recent refresh to the way in which Local Laws will be implemented within our developing community. With this refocus, a fantastic short-term opportunity is available to enforce various Acts, Regulations, Local Laws and policies appropriate to council’s regulatory functions in line with community needs.


This position aims to work collaboratively with other areas\xa0of the\xa0Safer Communities team to educate community residents on matters relating to traffic enforcement, animal management and local laws as well as to ensure that Council's statutory obligations under any Act, Regulation or Local Law for which the section is responsible are carried out in a courteous, effective\xa0and efficient manner.


About you

You are a team player with strong communication skills and fit enough to handle animals (dogs, cattle, or horses).\xa0 Your motivated and constructive approach will see you contribute to a positive and customer focused team culture.

We encourage people with a disability, lived experience of disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait islanders and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply for this position.


The City of Casey has zero tolerance for child abuse and is committed to creating and maintaining a child safe organisation where protecting children and preventing and responding to child abuse is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all Councillors, employees, contractors and volunteers.


The City of Casey reserves the right not to make any appointments for this position.

About the role

This role is dynamic and exciting role which requires high-level communication skills to effectively deal with a range of people, including international visitors and senior people in professions, business and government, to determine their requirements and act accordingly.

UX/UI Designer

Company Name Bastion Brands Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 112 views

Job description

Job Title: UX/UI Designer

Reporting to: Creative Services Manager & Creative Director

Exerience level: 3-5 years

Salary: Prorata of $70k\xa0

(option for full time for the right candidates - see details below)

\xa0

About Us

\xa0

Bastion Brands is a leading Australian Health and Wellness agency. We specialise in helping find the connection between science and emotion for some of the largest pharmaceutical brands in the world. Digital channels represent a key platform for many of our campaigns to effectively communicate to our audience and the need has arisen for a focused UX/UI designer to join the team.

\xa0

The UX-UI Designers will be responsible for collecting, researching, investigating and evaluating user requirements across all of our digital campaigns. Their responsibility is to deliver an outstanding user experience strategy, backed up with exceptional and intuitive design.

\xa0

Examples of the digital projects the UX/UI designer will be involved in are (and not limited to), websites, e-books and brochures, banners, digital sales aids, EDMs, apps, online videos and more.

\xa0

We anticipate the UX/UI design tasks will equate to approximately 3-4 days per week and as such, we are open to a number of flexible ways of working.

\xa0

For example, a part time approximately 3.5 day a week arrangement, or working 3.5 days on UX/UI projects with the rest of the working week supporting the design studio on more traditional design. OR this might suit a freelance UX/UI designer looking to base themselves from a location where they can operate some of their other personal clients for the remaining approx. 1.5 days per week.

\xa0

This is an incredibly important role at Bastion Brands and you will play a huge part in helping elevate our UX/UI delivery.

\xa0

We would prefer 3-5 years of experience (agency or client side)

\xa0

Our values.

\xa0

Culture and fit is a huge part of the success of Bastion Brands and we believe it is all about intent and attitude. These qualities represent the way we work, treat one another and service our clients.

\xa0

We run monthly B.B.P.O.D awards and review performance against these values.

\xa0

  • Bravery, Brilliance, Passion, Ownership, Determination

\xa0

Other beneficial traits

  • Communication skills both written and verbal
  • Great attention to detail – you sweat the small stuff
  • Good at predicting and managing turnaround times
  • Proactive – thinking outside the brief and suggesting new ideas or better ways to approach a task
  • Highly organised
  • Competent in multi-tasking and working under pressure
  • Approachable and easy to work with
  • Energetic - getting ‘stuck in’ when required
  • A strong character that can make sure things get done
  • Eager to learn and grow on a personal and professional level
  • Takes positive constructive criticism on board
  • Hungry to be a part of something bigger and to progress their career
  • Confident to express their opinion if deemed appropriate
  • Gain satisfaction from getting a job done quickly - and done well!\xa0

\xa0

Responsibilities and duties

\xa0

  • Taking and interrogating briefs
  • Predicting and mapping project scope, timings and allocations of time required
  • Researching customer behaviours and personas
  • Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with account managers, creatives and medical writers
  • Building navigation strategies and frameworks
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, wireframes / sitemaps
  • Presenting internally and to clients as required
  • Designing graphic elements that are both functional and visually appealing
  • Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate the platform’s look, feel and function.
  • Presenting internally and to clients as required
  • Identify and troubleshoot/test any UX problems (e.g. responsiveness/functionality) at multiple check points
  • Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
  • Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images


Requirements

\xa4 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role (preferably 3-5 years)

\xa4 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Portfolio of design projects

\xa4 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Knowledge of wireframe tools

\xa4 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Creative suite, After Effects, CSS, HTML, and other related software (Scetch, Balsamiq, Java Script etc)

\xa4 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Relevant Bachelor degree in computer science and or design.



If you are nodding your head and feeling inspired whilst reading this .....Then this job is for you!\xa0\xa0Please apply through LinkedIn or send a cover letter and CV to our talent consultant Serrin on serrindewar@gmail.com. As we are expecting a great deal of applications, we apologise in advance that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.\xa0

$55k Salary


Role Overview



The Technology Service Desk is looking to expand the team and offer a more robust support service to our global userbase. The successful candidate will make up part of a team that supports both remote end users and head office employees. Team members are encouraged to own an issue through to complete resolution and there are opportunities to input into the whole user experience.


Main Duties and Responsibilities


  • Providing a high level of technical support to resolve issues within an agreed SLA

  • Provide accurate call logging provide an incident audit trail

  • Work towards achieving and maintaining a high first call response

  • Deployment of global OS images and associated applications

  • Ownership and liaising with other business functions to ensure a resolution is reached in the quickest time possible

  • Working with 3rd party suppliers to maintain levels of service

  • Maintain hardware stock levels

  • Perform other duties as requested by the Technology Service Desk Manager

  • Assist with the broadcast and production of daily webcasts

\xa0

Candidates must possess the following skills and experience


  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

  • Offer software guidance to end users

  • The ability to balance customer focus with technical aptitude

  • Superior level of customer service, especially the ability to build good working relationships quickly

  • Ability to compile and maintain process documentation

  • Flexibility and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment

  • A desire to learn new skills

\xa0

Technical expertise in the following areas

\xa0

  • Windows 7 and 10 support

  • Office 365 Administration including the whole suite of applications

  • Exchange 2013 and Active Directory Administration

  • End user device imaging technologies

  • Mobile device management

  • Telephony and Broadband troubleshooting

  • An understanding of Networking technologies

\xa0

It would be desirable for the candidates to possess:


  • Any formal Microsoft training or qualifications

  • Any experience of supporting the travel industry

Job description

Associate Portfolio Manager


Take the next step up in your investment career with leading Investment Manager.


  • Leading Investment Management Group
  • Multi Sector Financial Markets Focus
  • Challenging new investment career move

This organisation is one of the cutting edge Leading Investment Managers in Australia which is experiencing continued growth in funds under management despite challenging global financial market conditions. As a leader in the design, build and maintenance of the highest levels of investment management service offerings available in it specialist sector, it is strategically positioned to offer its clients a Top Quartile performance for each market and asset class.

Reporting to the Head of Investments, you will be responsible for undertaking detailed investment quantitative strategies across multiple financial market sectors contributing to the strategic investment decisions of the portfolio. You will be responsible for refining investment quantitatives strategies to the portfolios, implementing investment strategies on fund manager selection and the portfolio allocation of investment portfolios.

Your challenge will be to focus on alpha returns in challenging global financial market conditions and improve risk/return characteristics to ensure ongoing top tier performance.

Ideally, you will have previous Senior Investment Analyst experience working in a financial markets environment, coupled with advanced quantitative analysis skills with broader economic knowledge from an investment management, investment consulting or Superannuation environment. A degree qualification in a finance discipline, with current postgraduate studies in CFA or Masters and a high degree of computer literacy especially or programming will be highly regarded.

\xa0Please contact Grant Executive Search on (03) 8601 1199 to find out further.

Job description





Chef de Partie

Nobu is the world’s most recognised Japanese restaurant is known for its innovative new-style Japanese cuisine with over 30 restaurants around the world.


Melbourne’s very own Nobu offers a contemporary atmosphere and stylish surrounds. The split level venue features a sushi bar, private dining room, main restaurant downstairs and bar upstairs, offering a full a la carte menu.


Reporting to the Chef de Cuisine, you will gain exposure to all different sections. At the Chef de Partie you will work in a large team, lead by example and ensure that the food stays true to the Nobu style. You will need to be able to run your own section and assist with developing Apprentices/Cooks.



Skills & Experience

  • Passion and dedication for cooking
  • Upmarket dining, high volume restaurants or hotel experience is highly desirable
  • Exceptional knife skills
  • Previous experience in Japanese Cuisine is desired
  • Ability to work as a part of a team environment
  • Capability to maintain high and consistent standards
  • Understanding of food safety standards and HACCP
  • Flexibility to work across a 7 day roster, including late evenings, weekends & public holidays


What we offer you:


• Recognition for your talents and contribution

• The opportunity to gain qualifications while you work

• Competitive salary package

Applications close: Sunday 9th of September 2018


As part of Crown's workplace inclusion and diversity strategy, we strongly encourage applications across all cultural backgrounds, genders and abilities.
